data.title: John O'Dreams - Symphony Pathetique
data.meta_description: John ODreams, arranged for Concert band by Geoff Kingston, is given the easy-listening treatment with lush scoring and harmonies. An enchanting setting that will ideal for band of all grades.
data.text:
John O' Dreams

Price: £29.99 (inc VAT)

Quantity:

About This Work

The lyrics for "John O'Dreams" were created by Bill Caddick, based upon the main theme from the first movement of Tchaikovsky's Symphony No.6 - the Pathetique. The song portrays all people as being equal in sleep with the central character being equivalent to the ‘Sandman', a mythical character who is said to sprinkle sand or dust into the eyes of children at night to bring on dreams and sleep.

Arranged for Concert Band by Geoff Kingston this beautiful melody is slightly slower in tempo than the original song and given the ‘easy-listening' treatment with lush scoring and harmonies. An enchanting setting that will ideal for band of all grades.

FeaturedNew ComposerPeter Ilyich Tchaikovsky KeyBb Major ArrangerGeoff Kingston CategoryConcert Band DurationCirca 3 mins 45 secs DifficultyThis piece has difficulty rating of 1.5 on a scale one through 6, with 6 being the hardest.
